Course details for first year of CPES Paris-Saclay

Core fundamentals block
L1 30 ECTS
Mathematics 1
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 18 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : Mathematics 1 Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 8 hours per week, 240 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 18 ECTS
Course description

This mathematics course focuses on three main themes: algebra, analysis and probabilities, based on the scientific preparatory classes curriculum.

It aims to reinforce high school foundations and standardize levels between those who took the advanced math option and others, while introducing new concepts such as vector spaces, matrices and complex numbers for those who have not covered them before, numerical series and probabilities on finite universes.

First instructor :

  • Ch1 - Fundamentals
    • Mathematical logic and reasoning methods
    • Membership and inclusion: notion of sets and operations on sets
    • Applications and functions: equality of functions, direct image, identity and indicator function, composed restrictions and extensions, injections surjections and bijections, inverse applications
  • Ch2 - Limits and continuity
    • Limits at infinity and at a point of a function, sequential characterization of limits
    • Notion of closure and closed intervals in R, continuity at a point and on an interval
    • Sequential characterization of continuity, left and right limits and continuity
    • Properties of operations on limits and order relations (bounded on a neighborhood, sign, comparison of limits, squeeze theorem, upper bound, monotone limit theorem)
    • Classic theorems (IVT and its corollary, continuity on a segment, bijection theorem)
  • Ch3 - Matrices
  • Ch4 - Differentiability
  • Ch5 - Linear systems
  • Ch6 - Geometry in 2 and 3 dimensions
  • Ch7 - R vector spaces
  • Ch8 - Complex numbers

Second instructor :

  • Chapter 1 - Sum and product
  • Chapter 2 - Arithmetic-geometric sequences and induction reasoning
  • Chapter 3 - Order in R
  • Chapter 4 - Sequence limits
  • Chapter 5 - Numerical series
  • Chapter 6 - Introduction to probabilities
  • Chapter 7 - Random variables
  • Chapter 8 - Sum of random variables
  • Chapter 9 - Primitives and integral calculus
  • Chapter 10 - Local comparison of functions
Computer Science 1
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 12 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : Computer Science 1 Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 6 hours per week, 180 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 12 ECTS
Course description

This course covers the basics of Python programming, with an approach focused on different programming paradigms, algorithmics and data structures (lists, trees, graphs).

It includes formal logic, as well as databases. Students also learn algorithm validation and testing, recursion, and proofs by induction.

Applied and specialization domains block
L1 22 ECTS
Health Track
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 7 ECTS
Elective Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : Health Track Duration : 24 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 96 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 7 ECTS
Course description

This Biology course is based on the first-year program of BCPST preparatory classes.

It focuses on the study of living things at multiple scales: molecular, cellular, organism and ecosystem. It also covers cell organization, metabolism (respiration, nutrition) and genetics (DNA structure, transmission of genetic information).

Society Track
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 7 ECTS
Elective Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : Society Track Duration : 24 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 96 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 7 ECTS
Course description

Presentation of sociology, its methods and approaches for analyzing society.

Sociological approaches and the sociologist's work

  • Presentation of sociology, its methods and approaches for analyzing society.

Health and well-being

  • Study of health and well-being issues, with a focus on risk management, illustrated by the example of health risk.

History of sociological thought

  • Durkheim: social bond, relevance of his work, extensions, individualism, sociology of work, changes in work and employment.
  • Marx: class conflict, social movements and social change.
  • Weber: rationality and evolution of social structure.

Sociology of work and social protection

  • Analysis of work transformations and social protection policies, including pensions, unemployment and health.
Economics, social policies and health
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 6 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : Economics, social policies and health Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 90 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 6 ECTS
Course description

This module offers a structured overview of the main fields of economics, combining historical, theoretical and applied approaches.

Foundations of economics and major schools of economic thought

  • Students explore the foundations of economics, the functions of the economy and the major schools of economic thought.

Introduction to microeconomics

  • Study of consumer microeconomic equilibrium and mechanisms governing individual economic choices.

Environmental economics

  • Exploration of interactions between economic activity and environment, and analysis of issues related to sustainability and resource management.

Market functioning and public intervention

  • Analysis of the role of markets in the economy and conditions for state intervention to regulate economic activity.
Institut Polytechnique Paris Project
Telecom Paris Polytechnic Institute of Paris 3 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Second semester Title : Institut Polytechnique Paris Project Duration : 15 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 30 hours per year Institution : Polytechnic Institute of Paris Teaching method : Tutorials Credits : 3 ECTS
Course description

This course introduces students to fundamental methods of statistical analysis, data processing and data visualization in Python.

Practical work is based on the most widely used numerical libraries (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn) and includes a pair project applied to real datasets. More advanced students can experiment with implementing simplified deep learning models.

This module combines statistical rigor, scientific programming practice and implementation of modern machine learning tools.

Introduction to AI
Paris-Saclay University 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : First semester Title : Introduction to AI Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 24 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Tutorials Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

The AI discovery course offers a fun and visual introduction to artificial intelligence - more precisely to statistical learning - through robot control.

The objective, based on practical work, is to develop intuition about learning algorithms (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning), to gradually arrive at mathematical formulations.

The implementation will be an opportunity to manipulate neural networks, computer vision and language processing. The necessary Python programming basics will be introduced progressively.

Introduction to data science
Paris-Saclay University 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Second semester Title : Introduction to data science Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 27 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

This introduction to data science course presents the basics of data collection, processing, analysis and visualization (including image analysis).

It covers the fundamentals of descriptive statistics and probability theory, using Python.

Through an image analysis and classification project, students learn to follow the complete data project processing chain, from the problem statement to the communication of results, with a strong practical component.

Introduction to Statistics
ENS Paris-Saclay 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Second semester Title : Introduction to Statistics Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 24 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

The introduction to Statistics course presents the fundamental notions of descriptive and inferential statistics, enabling the collection, organization, analysis and interpretation of numerical data.

It introduces students to the main methods for summarizing data, evaluating relationships between variables, and performing estimates and hypothesis tests.

Transversal block
L1 8 ECTS
English
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : English Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

This course follows an action-oriented approach across 5 skills (oral and written comprehension, written expression, continuous oral expression and interaction) with work on vowel sound pronunciation.

Interaction is through written and/or audiovisual documents centered on environmental and sustainable development issues and a communication scenario within a year-long project. Intercultural communication may be addressed within the project.

Culture / Sports / Second Language (LV2)
Paris-Saclay University 4 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : Culture / Sports / Second Language (LV2) Duration : 24 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 48 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

Physical, Sports and Artistic Activities of the student's choice or language teaching.

SPOC Critical Thinking: Science in Societies
Paris-Saclay University 0 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 1 Period : Throughout the year Title : SPOC Critical Thinking: Science in Societies Duration : Not specified Course hours : Not specified Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Small Private Online Course (SPOC) Credits : 0 ECTS
Course description

The Critical Thinking / Science in Societies SPOC is an online course designed to raise students' awareness of science-society interaction issues by developing their critical thinking.

It consists of five sessions of fun exercises based on audio, video and textual resources. Each session is linked to a theme examining a specific field of scientific knowledge, and to a question exploring a specific aspect of science/society interactions.
